publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-300 Tavish Scott: National Air Traffic Control—That the Parliament supports the campaign of the Public and Commercial Services Union to oppose the proposal to privatise 51% of the National Air Traffic Services, believes that the proposal poses a threat to safety in Scottish skies and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government opposing the proposal. Supported by: George Lyon*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Robert Brown*, Ian Jenkins*

S1M-300 Tavish Scott: National Air Traffic Control—That the Parliament supports the campaign of the Public and Commercial Services Union to oppose the proposal to privatise 51% of the National Air Traffic Services, believes that the proposal poses a threat to safety in Scottish skies and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government opposing the proposal. Supported by: George Lyon, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Keith Raffan, Robert Brown, Ian Jenkins, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-300 National Air Traffic Control (lodged on 18 November 1999) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-300 National Air Traffic Control (lodged on 18 November 1999) Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-300 Tavish Scott: National Air Traffic Control—That the Parliament supports the campaign of the Public and Commercial Services Union to oppose the proposal to privatise 51% of the National Air Traffic Services, believes that the proposal poses a threat to safety in Scottish skies and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government opposing the proposal. Supported by: George Lyon, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Keith Raffan, Robert Brown, Ian Jenkins, Mr Adam Ingram, Tommy Sheridan, Cathy Jamieson
S1M-300 National Air Traffic Control (lodged on 18 November 1999) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*

Supported by: George Lyon, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Keith Raffan, Robert Brown, Ian Jenkins, Mr Adam Ingram, Tommy Sheridan, Cathy Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie McGrigor

Supported by: George Lyon, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Keith Raffan, Robert Brown, Ian Jenkins, Mr Adam Ingram, Tommy Sheridan, Cathy Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Fergus Ewing
S1M-300 National Air Traffic Control (lodged on 18 November 1999) Alex Neil*

S1M-300 Tavish Scott: National Air Traffic Control—That the Parliament supports the campaign of the Public and Commercial Services Union to oppose the proposal to privatise 51% of the National Air Traffic Services, believes that the proposal poses a threat to safety in Scottish skies and calls upon the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government opposing the proposal. Supported by: George Lyon, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Keith Raffan, Robert Brown, Ian Jenkins, Mr Adam Ingram, Tommy Sheridan, Cathy Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Fergus Ewing, Alex Neil
